reviews.text: The cable car ride to get to the garden was great. The gardens have been well loved. Beautiful blooms even in March. Bring plenty of euros. Everything costs something. No charge cards. Entry fee, additional cable ride to other garden, sled ride down the hill. Fun but a little expensive day

Worth a visit because it's still a great garden with incredible views and considerable effort has gone into it. Some really nice displays, lawns etc. Just considerably outdone by the Monte Palace gardens. Botanics had lots of employees out working hard but just felt a little run down despite this and lacked the variety and interest of the other gardens. lots of cracked paint on walls and handrails, broken steps, empty ponds, plants well cared for but the curation was a bit uninspired in some areas.

I really enjoyed walking here. The garden had a lot of beautiful flowers and plants and little lizards. It is not stroller or wheelchair accessible but there are little seats and a lot of shade to rest when tired. Come with very comfortable walking shoes and umbrella if you will be visiting in the afternoon and a bottle of water.

Interesting, but watch out because there is no atm around and they don't accept cards. Entrance is 6€per person, which is quite reasonable. The garden is well maintained and has a lot of variety to look and smell. Also has a couple of nice view points.

Very disappointing experience.  We had previously visited the Monte palace gardens which were superb and were looking forward to these. We found the staff very unhelpful at the entrance. They were more interested in the tours that were arriving. The gardens were rather dull apart from the main formal garden. The most disappointing aspect was the lack of water features.  They were either empty or stagnant.

An excellent experience.  The gardens are stunning throughout.  The paths are well maintained and we'll signed. The exhibition of African art was fascinating. The staff at the entrance were very helpful as were those in the cafe. I would go again.

Amazing tropical gardens set high up the mountain with fabulous views of Madeira's spectacular coastline. Can be reached by cable car, bus or taxi. The botanical gardens are also well worth a visit - just another short cable car ride away. The stunning and imposing Church is very much the centre point of Monte , open and welcoming. Hurtling down a very steep cobblestone street in a basket pushed by two young men dressed in white suits and straw boaters is an experience not to be missed! Well worth a visit

A perfect place to spend a few hours. I visited late afternoon in February and it was very quiet. Ticket purchased at the door gave access to the museum (African sculpture art), botanical gardens and also free Madeiran wine tasting (1 each).
I would have liked more info on the varied flora within the gardens due to the unique climate of the island, but I suppose this is not essential. 
I was told by a few locals that these gardens are the best on the island. I can see why.

What an amazing place this is. Took the cable car up, had coffee and then took a walk around one of the best gardens u will ever get to see. You walk down, down down meandering through and over the Chinese bridges. You eventually get to the Palace and then more. The flowing water and waterfalls are just a joy to see. It is a long walk down but for 2 euro 50 they will transport you back up to the top again. Great for photos. Just one thing it can get cool underneath the trees so take a jacket.

The tropical gardens at Monte Palace is breathtaking. There is so much to see and around every corner is a new surprise. Great place to spend the day and unwind. From the trickling sound of water throughout the gardens to the birds singing in the trees. You will not want to leave this magical place.
Great set of formal rooms in French high-art style - the balcony-tower with built-in seated areas was my favorite.
Lovely place special for someone that love the History of Madeira, 5***** .
Interesting free tour of the old fortress!

Interesting but left us with more questions than answers about the history! Somewhat expected since the military museum is run by the military, but even the tactical/battle information was pretty sparse.
Beautiful building !

Beautiful big church, fully decorated. Located  on a square, next to the city hall. 
For 1€ (adults) you can visit the tower and have a view over the city!
Beautiful, amazing make a point of going, so peaceful & moving
The most beautiful interior of a church in Madeira, a must visit. Just take note of the opening hours, but you can get lucky if there is a wedding happening.
Superb church, must see.do not forget to go up the tower.
Very beautiful church
Fortress without art exhibits. There was a classic car at the time of visit. A fee is required to view the premises. A restaurant exists inside on the lower level.
Great little fortress with impressive location. Could have more things to see and do.

It's a fort on the coast.  These days it's protecting the sunbathers on the beaches.  Has a nice elevated view and a vintage car which sits in the courtyard.  A crew was setting up for an evening party on one of the upper outdoor sections when I walked through.  I'm not sure where guests could park, but if you can make it here it's likely a good as spot as any for a party.
A very nice building, a landmark in the old town
Amazing place, very romantic. Breathtaking views. Very peaceful place!
Brilliant shop with low prices for Madeira Wine!
Fab Maderian supermarket that has everything you would need on holiday at reasonable prices. It's located in the shopping centre lower floor.

A bit difficult to navigate if you’re used to how UK supermarket arrangement but I can assure you everything is still there. Large and resourceful with very good prices. Large butchers, fishmongers and bakery sections make it very convenient when shopping for the basics. Staff all spoke very good English and were happy to help finding things around the store when stuck.
Good supermarket if not most busy on a Sunday lunchtime. Wide choice available and very clean.
Good supermarket in central funchal.

Fab setting overlooking the ocean and beautiful natural pool formation, but overly salty food - that is why 3 and not 4 stars. We had a great time and ate practically most of the seafood offered, including picking our own fish to be grilled. Everything was fresh and yummy - but very salty - this is coming from a person who likes and craves salt!  Could have been a one off... so still recommend going and trying this lovely spot. The red sauce they served was so good, we kept on dipping our fish then bread. Service was great; on point, very attentive, and helpful. The ambiance is cozy, white table cloth setting. Recommend you go before the sunset as the view is what this place is all about.

The food was not great. The scabbard felt like it was microwaved, the chips were soft but had a lovely taste of garlic.

They also gave us bread and butter when we were seated, but they also put that up on our bill without asking any questions about it at all.

The second star is for the great view, but I will not return here.
Best seafood restaurant we found during our stay! The service was a bit grumpy, but the food was excellent. Highly recommended!!
Good place to watch the sunset, food and service average at best
Great view. Okayish-at-best food. Very relaxed service.

Not bad, not amazing either. Service was pleasant and prices good. Sushi pieces can vary in size and tend to be a little small. 

Wouldn't go back, unless they sorted out a few things. 

We've had some great experiences with sushi so this is a highish standard we have, so I would say this place needs to improve, and is a bit lacking in professional direction in general. As a hotel general manager this my honest opinion.
Best Sushi of my Life! Great Little local and great Service. Thank you for this amazing experience :-)

Great quality, very friendly staff, the food was really tasty and great appearance, the only down part was really the time it took to serve us, gaffe to wait a long time to get my food. But besides that everything was great including the prices. Certainly a place to return with some friends, hopefully the service will be faster.

Delicious fusion sushi done right. Every piece was carefully balanced and used local ingredients in a way that was creative and delicious. Textures and flavours were varied and exciting! Plus the set menus are very well priced for the amount of food you get and the artistry that goes into them! Difficult to figure out how to get in if you arrive early--the door is red with no sign on it, but it will open when the restaurant opens!
Very creative Japanese restaurant, the service was impeccable and the prices reasonable.

Had tea time here.  Make sure to wear a suit jacket or you are going to feel under dressed.  The view is good.  The wait staff are attentive.  You are really paying for the ambience in my opinion because the food is....  well its tea and sandwiches... lol

Had afternoon tea. Lovely old hotel in great condition. Afternoon tea was nice overlooking Funchal harbour. Staff are great and attentive, but not overly. It's expensive for what you get, but while on holiday why not treat yourself. Winston Churchill did!

We went for afternoon tea.  It was a pleasure through and through. Service, china, table wear, champagne, food everything was sharp, crisp and wonderful.  Staff was polite and attentive.  View is spectacular and I truly adore that this hotel is not ruined by any distasteful modern upgrade. Everything is beautiful wellcared for.  You would not be surprised if Hercule Poirot tripped out on this stunning balcony. Just missed the 5 stars - my Earl Grey tea was bland and a bit bitter.
Beautiful view on balcony.  Afternoon tea very enjoyable.  Lovely sandwiches
Seriously, if you have come to madeira, this is a must. Whether it's just for a drink, afternoon tea or staying. It's beautiful. 😁

Yves Gautier Gautier sabe o que a Madeira oferece de excecional, produtos regionais únicos combinados com o 'savoir faire' de um chefe que respeita a regionalidade e adiciona a internacionalidade ... Vinhos sem exceção de todas as regiões continentais e regional, apresentados e defendidos pelo sommelier residente entusiasta ... Têm uma carta de vinhos de guarda únicos, lembra-se do Redoma Branco Reserva 2003, Batuta 1999, quinta Vale de Meão 2003 ... lá estão para comprovarem que envelhecem surpreendentemente bem e mais anos têm para dar ... !!
Tão perto do Céu, nas montanhas madeirenses encontre um oásis gastronómico ... 
VALE A PENA!

Cuisine présomptueuse et sans saveur !
De plus, beaucoup trop cher, il n'y a pas de matière première qui le justifie.
Un nouveau chef viens tout juste d'arriver, en espérant qu'il relève le niveau.

Our last year at The Residence  
I have loved our last 10 years at this hotel but it's time to move on. It is spotlessly clean, all the staff are lovely and the facilities second to none.

Excellent service and very comfortable rooms and suites. 
A very busy hotel but with a quiet atmosphere
Beautiful gardens and good food.
Excellent location with a very helpful and kind staff. We enjoyed our stay very much. Thank you!
Great hotel with nice garden, pool, rooms and restaurants. We had a good stay! And also to be mentioned is the free parking in the garage.
Excellent place to stay and the most wonderful & helpful staff... I come here year after year (8 times so far)

Had tea time here.  Make sure to wear a suit jacket or you are going to feel under dressed.  The view is good.  The wait staff are attentive.  You are really paying for the ambience in my opinion because the food is....  well its tea and sandwiches... lol

Had afternoon tea. Lovely old hotel in great condition. Afternoon tea was nice overlooking Funchal harbour. Staff are great and attentive, but not overly. It's expensive for what you get, but while on holiday why not treat yourself. Winston Churchill did!

We went for afternoon tea.  It was a pleasure through and through. Service, china, table wear, champagne, food everything was sharp, crisp and wonderful.  Staff was polite and attentive.  View is spectacular and I truly adore that this hotel is not ruined by any distasteful modern upgrade. Everything is beautiful wellcared for.  You would not be surprised if Hercule Poirot tripped out on this stunning balcony. Just missed the 5 stars - my Earl Grey tea was bland and a bit bitter.
Beautiful view on balcony.  Afternoon tea very enjoyable.  Lovely sandwiches
Seriously, if you have come to madeira, this is a must. Whether it's just for a drink, afternoon tea or staying. It's beautiful. 😁
